name: Magic Coat

name: Psybeam

notes: Spin again until an attack other than Focus Energy is spun. Damage attacks deal +20 damage,

name: Thunder Jolt

notes: If this Pokémon is knocked out, the battle opponent becomes Paralyzed.

name: Fire Fang
notes: The battle opponent is now burned. The battle opponent gains Wait

name: Double Flight
notes: This Pokémon jumps over the battle opponent and lands on a surrounding point. If the opposing Pokémon is affected by a special condition, it is knocked out. After moving, this Pokémon may attack an opposing Pokémon again, but just once.

name: Water Slide
notes: The battle opponent is knocked 1 step back and gains Wait

name: Rock Wrecker
notes: Knock out 1 of your opponent's Flying-type Pokémon within 2 steps. (When using the Long Barrel plate: "Knock out 1 of your opponent's Fire, Ice, Flying or Bug-type Pokémon that are 2 or 3 steps away.)

name: Bulldozer
notes: This Pokémon knocks the battle opponent one step back and claims its previous spot

name: Rock Blast
notes: Spin again until Rock Blast does not land - damage is multiplied by the number of Rock Blast spins

name: Lick
notes: If this Pokémon is knocked out, the battle opponent becomes paralyzed

name: Eats Anything
notes: Switches one of the opponent's plates from unused to used. When this Pokémon (or a Pokémon that evolved from this Pokémon) leaves the field, return as many plates as were switched to be used with this Attack since this Pokémon entered the field back to unused

name: Grass Whistle
notes: The battle opponent falls asleep

name: Thrash
notes: This Pokémon becomes confused

name: Horn Drill
notes: The battle opponent is Knocked Out

name: Electric Blast
notes: All Pokémon adjacent to the opponent Pokémon are Paralysed

name: Thunder Punch
notes: If this Pokémon is knocked out when it uses this attack, the battle opponent becomes paralyzed.

name: Water Shuriken
notes: Spin again until Water Shuriken attack does not land - damage is multiplied by the number of Water Shuriken Attack spins. An opponent next to the target spins, and if it spins a Purple Attack, then it is knocked out

name: Toxic Spikes
notes: The battle opponent becomes poisoned. This Pokémon retreats one step

name: Rapid Spin
notes: Spin again until Rapid Spin does not land - damage is multiplied by the number of Rapid Spin spins

name: Mid-Air Strike
notes: Opponent Pokémon is pushed back one space. This Pokémon gains Wait

name: Aerial Attack
notes: Opponent Pokémon is pushed back one space. This Pokémon waits

name: Tentacle Barrage
notes: This move's damage is boosted by the number of Pokémon on the field that know moves that can cause Poison or Toxic status effect, plus 10.If this Pokémon faints, the battle opponent will become Poisoned

name: Conceal
notes: If the damage inflicted onto this Pokémon is 100 or less, this Pokémon does not faint.

name: Harden
notes: If the battle opponent spins an Attack of 100 damage or less, this Pokémon is not knocked out. While this Pokémon is on the field, the Attacks of this Pokémon, other than Harden, deal +10 damage

name: Smog
notes: The battle opponent is poisoned.

name: Sludge
notes: If this Pokémon is knocked out, the battle opponent becomes poisoned

name: Rollout
notes: Spin again until Rollout does not land - damage is multiplied by the number of Rollout spins

name: Landslide
notes: The battle opponent is knocked 1 step back and gains Wait

name: Needle Arm
notes: The battle opponent gains Wait

name: Arm Thrust
notes: Spin again until Arm Thrust does not land - damage is multiplied by the number of Arm Thrust spins. If the number of attacks spun was 2 or more, this Pokémon cannot be knocked out

name: Parting Shot
notes: This Pokémon may switch with a Pokémon on your bench. The battle opponent now has Wait.

name: Spiky Shield
notes: The battle opponent is knocked 2 steps back and gains Wait 3

name: Assist
notes: A random Pokémon on your bench other than Liepard spins. The attack that is spun takes the place of this attack

name: Draining Wind
notes: One Pokémon within 3 steps' range is drawn 1-2 steps closer to this Pokémon and gains Wait.

name: Dark Mist
notes: When this Pokémon is on the field, your Dark-type Pokémon receive a +10 boost to attack damage

name: Drain Wind
notes: Move a Pokémon within 3 steps of this Pokémon to 1 or 2 spaces from this Pokémon. Their movement is reduced by one

name: Geomancy
notes: Spin again until an Attack other than Geomancy is spun. Damage attacks do +50 damage

name: Fairy Mist
notes: When this Pokémon is on the field, your Fairy-type Pokémon receive a +10 boost to attack damage

name: Trickery
notes: Shifts this Pokémon's Attacks two segments clockwise

name: Sand-Attack
notes: This Pokémon's move may shift two places clockwise

name: Lullaby
notes: All adjacent Pokémon are Asleep

name: Burrow
notes: This Pokémon moves to the other side of the opposing Pokémon

name: Push Away
notes: This Pokémon knocks the battle opponent one step back and claims its previous spot

name: Throw Back
notes: This Pokémon knocks the opponent back one space and moves onto the space the opponent occupied

name: Hex
notes: If the battle opponent has a status condition, damage is x2

name: Water Jump
notes: This Pokémon can move to a point that is 2 steps away. In that case, it gains Wait

name: Hydro Kick
notes: Benches your battle Pokémon (excent when opponent has Fainted). Your battle opponent must then Wait.

name: Eerie Light
notes: The battle opponent becomes confused

name: Rest
notes: This Pokémon falls asleep

name: Fake Sleep
notes: Allows this Pokémon to respin once

name: Body Slam
notes: The battle opponent becomes paralyzed.

name: Tentacle Sting
notes: If this Pokémon is knocked out, the battle opponent becomes poisoned or paralyzed

name: Paralysis Job
notes: If this Pokémon faints, the opponent Pokémon will be either Poisoned or Paralysed

name: Land's Wrath
notes: All other Pokémon on the field spin - those that spin purple are knocked out

name: Vanish
notes: This Pokémon moves to the bench and gains Wait.

name: Disappear
notes: This Pokémon returns to the bench. This Pokémon must wait 1 turn

name: Iron Defense
notes: This Pokémon gains Wait.

name: Startling Powder
notes: The battle opponent either becomes poisoned, paralyzed, or fals asleep.

name: Super Powder
notes: The opponent Pokémon becomes Poisoned, Paralysed or Asleep

name: Poison Gas
notes: The battle opponent becomes poisoned

name: Psychic Blow
notes: Push the Pokémon backwards on the board as far as they can go. If they hit any other Pokémon, they are pushed back too. All Pokémon wait 1 turn

name: Toxic Fluid
notes: The battle opponent becomes noxious.

name: Poison Tail
notes: If this Pokémon is knocked out, the opponent Pokémon becomes poisoned

name: Toxic Venom
notes: The opponent Pokémon is now Badly Poisoned

name: Tease
notes: Switch this Pokémon with the adjacent opponent Pokémon.

name: Hyper Take Down
notes: If the battle opponent is knocked out, this Pokémon claims its previous spot and gains Wait.

name: Psychic Power
notes: The battle opponent is moved to the bench and gains Wait.

name: Psycho Power
notes: Move this Pokémon to the Bench. This Pokémon has to wait 1 turn

name: Acrobatics
notes: If the battle opponent is knocked out, this Pokémon moves one step and gains Wait.

name: Poison Kick
notes: If this Pokémon is knocked out, the battle opponent becomes poisoned

name: Press
notes: If the opponent's Pokémon is knocked out, so is this Pokémon.

name: Flight
notes: This Pokémon jumps over the opponent Pokémon

name: Sweet Kiss
notes: The battle opponent becomes confused

name: Lovely Kiss
notes: The opponent Pokémon is now Asleep

name: Spit Poison
notes: The battle opponent becomes poisoned

name: Venom
notes: The opponent Pokémon is now Poisoned

name: Dark Void
notes: The battle opponent and all opposing Pokémon adjacent to it spin, and if they spin a White Attack, they fall asleep

name: Dark Leap
notes: You can move this Pokémon 2 steps. If you do, this Pokémon gains Wait

name: Dark Leave
notes: The opponent Pokémon is pushed 2 places away. The opponent waits

name: Poison Powder
notes: The battle opponent becomes poisoned

name: Self-Destruct
notes: This Pokémon and the battle opponent are knocked out

name: Self Destruct
notes: This Pokémon and all adjacent Pokémon faint.

name: Wash Away
notes: The battle opponent is knocked  back 2 steps and gains Wait.

name: Scissor Toss
notes: The battle opponent is knocked  back 1 step and gains Wait.

name: Scissor Guillotine
notes: Stuns the opponent Pokémon

name: Scissor Throw
notes: Knocks opponent Pokémon out. Opponent Pokémon waits 1 turn

name: Push Aside
notes: The battle opponent is moved to the bench and gains Wait.

name: Freeze Tail
notes: If this Pokémon is knocked out, the battle opponent becomes frozen.

name: Mystery Disappearance
notes: The opponent moves back to the bench. It has to wait 1 turn

name: Spacial Rend
notes: If the battle is a tie, the battle opponent is excluded from the duel

name: Fire Spin
notes: Spin again until Fire Spin does not land - damage is multiplied by the number of Fire Spin spins

name: Teeter Dance
notes: All neighbour Pokémon become confused

name: Disable
notes: The battle opponent now has Wait.

name: Butterfly Effect
notes: If this Pokémon faints, then the opponent Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Tidal Wave
notes: All neighbour Pokémon are knocked 3 steps back and gain Wait.

name: Healing Wish
notes: This Pokémon switches with another of your Pokémon from the P.C.

name: Heal Pulse
notes: Remove all Special Effects of all adjacent Pokémon

name: Overhead Toss
notes: The opponent is moved 1 step behind this Pokémon

name: Big Bite
notes: If the battle opponent's type is Steel, this Pokémon takes no damage and the opponent is knocked out.

name: Bite Down
notes: If the opponent Pokémon is a Steel Pokémon, this Pokémon does not get Knocked Out. Opponent Pokémon is stunned.

name: Blind
notes: This Pokémon moves 1-2 steps back

name: Cyclone
notes: The battle opponent is moved to the bench and gains Wait.

name: Fake Tears
notes: Spin again until an attack other than Fake Tears is spun. Damage attacks deal +20 damage,

name: Pull In
notes: Moves the battle opponent to the P.C. and moves this Pokémon to the bench

name: String Wrap
notes: Attaches an MP-1 marker to the battle opponent

name: String Shot
notes: The opponent's movement is reduced by 1

name: Defense Curl
notes: If the battle opponent's Attack is below 50 damage, this Pokémon cannot be Knocked out.

name: Step Away
notes: This Pokémon moves 1-3 steps back.

name: Beware
notes: This Pokémon moves back 1 to 3 spaces

name: Smokescreen
notes: The battle opponent now has Wait.

name: Kick Away
notes: The battle opponent is knocked 2 steps back (the opponent chooses the point) and gains Wait

name: Kick
notes: Opponent is forced to move 2 spaces backwards. Position is chosen by opponent

name: Roar of Time
notes: Return the battle opponent to their start-of-the-duel state (excluding evolution)
